title: Impressions II
text:
writhe and
gape of tortured

  perspective
  rasp and graze of splintered

normality
          crackle and
          sag
 of planes      clamors of
 collision
 collapse      As

peacefully,
lifted
into the awful beauty
                      of sunset

                      the young city
putting off dimension with a blush
enters
the becoming garden of her agony
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “Tulips and Chimneys”
